#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Encourage a New Pet to Trust You
#Text=Everybody is excited when they get a new pet .
#Text=Before you start in with your new pet , you want to gain its trust first .
#Text=There is nothing like having your pet trust you and it can lead to a long , successful relationship .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Find a suitable space for the pet to settle in .
#Text=When you get your pet home , place it in its proper cage or area and let it get used to its surroundings .
#Text=For reptiles and small animals , put them in their cage and let them have some time to themselves to explore their new house .
#Text=For dogs or cats , let them roam around your house and get used to the unfamiliar area ( or at least a pet-proofed portion of it ) .
#Text=Allow the pet to become familiar with you .
#Text=After a while , let the animal get used to your presence .
#Text=Walk by cage slowly and quietly to show your reptile or small animal that you 're not a threat .
#Text=Spend a little time in the same room as your cat or dog .
#Text=Feed the animal , by hand if possible .
#Text=Like they say , the best way to an animal 's heart is through its stomach .
#Text=Hand-feeding your reptile or small animal establishes a form of trust between you .
#Text=Show your cat or dog that you are the one preparing and providing its food .
#Text=Pet it .
#Text=Stroke your lizard 's head or your small animal 's body gently and slowly .
#Text=This shows that you mean no harm .
#Text=Pet your cat or dog 's body , or any other place they like to be pet .
#Text=It 's not a good idea to pet a dog on the head , as this is considered a threat to them if they do n't know you well and have n't learned your body language .
#Text=Try holding your lizard or small animal .
#Text=Fully support their body and sit in a chair or anywhere comfortable .
#Text=Walking around with them will mostly likely make them nervous .
#Text=Let your cat relax next to you or walk your dog .
#Text=Play with your cat or dog , as it becomes comfortable with your presence .
#Text=It will help establish a strong bond .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Respect their feelings .
#Text=If they do not want to be held , do n't force it .
#Text=If they do n't want to relax next to you or go for a walk , do n't force it .
#Text=This will cause unnecessary stress to your pet .
#Text=Do not get discouraged when they get nervous or scared .
#Text=You 're a new and strange creature to them and it 's understandable if they feel that way .
#Text=Try this during the evening , when your hamster is most likely to be awake and bond-making .
#Text=Have a toy or a treat for them when they do respond positively .
#Text=Do n't reach out and pick up your new pet right away .
#Text=Let it come to you .
#Text=Especially if your pet is a small animal .
#Text=It 's quite possible that you will be perceived as a hungry predator .
#Text=Imagine if you were a little creature and some giant thing came out of nowhere and whisked you away .
#Text=For the first few days bring toys , food , or treats every time you visit your pet .
#Text=This will cause them to associate your presence with good things and make them more comfortable around you .
#Text=Watch your new pet and notice what it enjoys .
#Text=Remember , you are learning about it , too .
#Text=Read up on your new pet , preferably before you get it .
#Text=This is especially important if this is your first animal of this type .
#Text=Know how to make your new pet comfortable .
#Text=Keep the animal 's living conditions clean and hygienic .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Do n't hit your animal if things do n't go your way .
#Text=This is a very negative reaction and will cause your pet to be very questionable of you .
#Text=If your pet acts hostile to your advances , leave them alone and do n't try to further your bond for a moment .
#Text=The animal is mostly likely nervous or scared and it can result in harm to you and the animal .
#Text=Do n't overdo it .
#Text=If your pet wants to be left alone , leave it alone .
#Text=If you keep annoying it , it might think you are a nuisance or even belligerent .
